sentence.Network_en: He is good at mastering horse.
He studied English hard with a view to mastering it quickly.
sentence.Network_cn: 他为了尽快精通英语而努力学习.

sentence.Network_en: It is the prerequisite for mastering the future and overcoming the past.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是摈弃过去,掌握未来的必要前提.

PerfectNetExp.abs: Gestures and facial expressions may assist a child in mastering his native language ., 手势和脸部表情可能协助一个孩子学好他的母语.

entry.def: A servant's master is the man that he or she works for.

example.ex: My master ordered me not to deliver the message except in private...
example.tran: 我的主人命令我务必私下里传递消息。

example.ex: In 1777 several northern states encouraged white masters to free their slaves for military service.
example.tran: 1777年，北方的几个州鼓励白人奴隶主解放奴隶，让他们参军。

entry.def: A dog's master is the man or boy who owns it.

example.ex: The dog yelped excitedly when his master opened a desk drawer and produced his leash.
example.tran: 主人打开抽屉拿出牵狗用的皮带时，狗兴奋地叫了起来。

entry.def: If you say that someone is a master of a particular activity, you mean that they are extremely skilled at it.

example.ex: She was a master of the English language...
He is a master at blocking progress...
example.tran: 他特别擅长充当拦路虎。

entry.def: If you are master of a situation, you have complete  control over it.

example.ex: Jackson remained calm and always master of his passions...
example.tran: 杰克逊镇定自若，始终克制着情绪。

example.ex: He was under no illusions as to who was master in his house.
example.tran: 对于谁当家作主，他不抱任何幻想。

entry.def: If you master something, you learn how to do it properly or you succeed in understanding it completely.

example.ex: Duff soon mastered the skills of radio production...
example.tran: 达夫很快掌握了广播节目制作的技能。

example.ex: Students are expected to master a second language.
example.tran: 学生应该掌握一门第二语言。

entry.def: If you master a difficult situation, you succeed in controlling it.

example.ex: When you have mastered one situation you have to go on to the next...
example.tran: 一旦控制住了一个局面，又得接着应付下一个。

example.ex: His genius alone has mastered every crisis.
example.tran: 仅凭天分，他就控制了所有的危机。

entry.def: A master is a male teacher.

example.ex: Mr Palmer was a retired maths master.
example.tran: 帕尔默先生是一名退休的数学教师。

entry.def: A famous male painter of the past is often called a master .

example.ex: ...a portrait by the Dutch master, Vincent Van Gogh.
example.tran: 一幅由荷兰著名画家文森特·凡·高所作的画像

entry.tran: （电影、录音等）原始拷贝的，母盘的，母带的
entry.def: A master copy of something such as a film or a tape recording is an original copy that can be used to produce other copies.

example.ex: Keep one as a master copy for your own reference and circulate the others.
example.tran: 一盘留作母带自用，其余的都分发出去。

entry.def: The master of a ship that carries passengers or goods is its captain.
A master's degree can be referred to as a master's .

example.tran: 我获得了经济学硕士学位。

entry.tran: 长老(信徒对宗教法师或领袖的称呼)
entry.def: Master is sometimes used by the followers of a male religious teacher or leader as a way of referring to him or addressing him.

example.ex: She believed that she had been selected by the Master to reveal forgotten wisdom.
example.tran: 她认为自己是被长老选中来揭示被人们遗忘的智慧的。

entry.tran: (旧时的)少爷，小主人;君(现在用于信件中对男孩的称谓)
entry.def: In the past, Master was used before a boy's name as a polite way of referring to him or addressing him. Nowadays, Master can be written before a boy's name when addressing a letter to him.

example.ex: Nice to see you, Master Simon.
example.tran: 很高兴见到您，西蒙少爷。

entry.def: If you say that you are your own master, you mean that your decisions are not controlled by other people and you are free to do what you want.

example.ex: It was no place for a man who liked to be his own master.
example.tran: 这绝非喜爱独立自主的人能呆下去的地方。

means.word_mean: 1. becoming proficient in the use of something; having mastery of;

sentences.sentence: "his mastering the art of cooking took a long time"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of making a master recording from which copies can be made;

sentences.sentence: "he received a bill for mastering the concert and making 100 copies"

auth_sentence.res_content: Paul said that mastering the techniques required much hard work.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Paul said that mastering the techniques required much hard work.

auth_sentence.res_content: The album was mastered at Blue Pro Mastering in London.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The album was mastered at Blue Pro Mastering in London.

Sentence.sentence: An obsession (沉迷) with time – saving, gaining, wasting, losing, and mastering it – seems to have been a part of humanity for as long as human have existed.

The Home Depot approach to craftsmanship - simplify it, dumb it down, hire a contractor - is one signal that mastering tools and working with one's hands is receding in America as a hobby, as a valued skill, as a cultural influence that shaped thinking and behavior in vast sections of the country.
What does the author think of mastering tools and working with one's hands
